bug.author: cepera-ang
bug.summary: cmake stuck in infinite loop at configuration if nvcc is not found
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>Description</denchmark-h>
I'm trying to build Mxnet from source using this guide <denchmark-link:https://mxnet.apache.org/get_started/ubuntu_setup>https://mxnet.apache.org/get_started/ubuntu_setup</denchmark-link> and at running command the build is stuck at infinite loop. <denchmark-h:h3>Error Message</denchmark-h>

Last lines look relevant. And than the process repeats itself indefinitely: <denchmark-code>-- The C compiler identification is GNU 8.3.0 -- The CXX compiler identification is GNU 8.3.0 -- Check for working C compiler: /usr/local/bin/cc -- Check for working C compiler: /usr/local/bin/cc -- works ... </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Follow <denchmark-link:https://mxnet.apache.org/get_started/ubuntu_setup>https://mxnet.apache.org/get_started/ubuntu_setup</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h3>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
(Paste the commands you ran that produced the error.) 1.Install prerequisites 2. Clone repo and copy config <denchmark-code>git clone --recursive https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet.git mxnet cd mxnet cp config/linux_gpu.cmake config.cmake # or config/linux_gpu.cmake for build with CUDA </denchmark-code>
The only change in config I did -- I disabled OpenCV.
Run config:
<denchmark-code>rm -rf build mkdir -p build && cd build cmake .. </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>What have you tried to solve it?</denchmark-h>
I uncommented CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER line and removed cache from there set(CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER "nvcc" STRING "Cuda compiler (nvcc)")
And it's building as it should.
<denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
We recommend using our script for collecting the diagnositc information. We recently added a convenience functionality in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/pull/17293>#17293</denchmark-link> that attempts to do the right thing even if cuda is not installed correctly. Seems that leads to an infinite loop unfortunately. It needs to be fixed. Thanks for reporting the issue. You didn't install cuda correctly. In particular you didn't do <denchmark-link:https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cuda-installation-guide-linux/index.html#mandatory-post>https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cuda-installation-guide-linux/index.html#mandatory-post</denchmark-link>
nvcc is not on your PATH. As a quick workaround, you can run with CUDACXX=/usr/local/cuda/nvcc cmake

Thanks for the update <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cepera-ang>@cepera-ang</denchmark-link> . Could you try changing if (NOT CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER_LOADED AND UNIX AND EXISTS "/usr/local/cuda/bin/nvcc") to if (NOT CMAKE_CUDA_COMPILER AND UNIX AND EXISTS "/usr/local/cuda/bin/nvcc") Seems in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/pull/17293>#17293</denchmark-link> we used the wrong variable, as per <denchmark-link:https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/issues/19013>https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/issues/19013</denchmark-link>

The search behavio for CUDAToolkit is specified in <denchmark-link:https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/-/blob/master/Modules/FindCUDAToolkit.cmake>https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/-/blob/master/Modules/FindCUDAToolkit.cmake</denchmark-link> In general, it relies on the location of nvcc, so it may get confused by . It's a strange location to have nvcc at. Did you install the cuda libraries also to ? Usually they are at . The infinite loop issue is a separate issue and should be fixed by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/pull/17773>#17773</denchmark-link> .

It is indeed strange location for nvcc and it happens to be some misconfiguration on my machine. is a symbolic link to and removing it solves the problem (tried with changes in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/pull/17773>#17773</denchmark-link> ). Thanks for you time <denchmark-link:https://github.com/leezu>@leezu</denchmark-link> ! It is rare to get this kind of fast and thorough response with open source project and I highly appreciate it.
